The language of the response. Valid values:

*   en: English

parameters.name: HalfOpenBaseAmountPerStep
parameters.description: The minimum number of requests that can be passed in each step after circuit breaking recovers. Default value: 1.

parameters.name: HalfOpenRecoveryStepNum
parameters.description: The number of circuit breaking recovery steps. Default value: 1.

parameters.name: MaxAllowedRtMs
parameters.description: The maximum response time (RT). Unit: milliseconds. If the RT of a request is greater than the value of this parameter, a slow call is counted. If you set Strategy to 0, you must specify this parameter.

parameters.name: MinRequestAmount
parameters.description: The minimum number of requests to trigger circuit breaking. If the number of requests in the current time window is less than the value of this parameter, circuit breaking is not triggered even if the circuit breaking rule is met. Default value: 10.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The microservice namespace to which the application belongs.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region in which the instance resides.

parameters.name: Resource
parameters.description: The name of the interface to which the rule applies. The interface name must be the same as the name on the interface details page in the console.

parameters.name: RetryTimeoutMs
parameters.description: The period in which circuit breaking is implemented. Unit: milliseconds. If circuit breaking is implemented on the requests for the route, the calls to all the requests for the route fail in the configured circuit breaking period. The value must be an integral multiple of 1,000. Default value: 10000. This value indicates 10 seconds.

parameters.name: StatIntervalMs
parameters.description: The length of the time window. Unit: milliseconds. The valid range is from 1 second to 120 minutes. The default value is 20000. This value indicates 20 seconds.

parameters.name: Threshold
parameters.description: A percentage threshold for triggering circuit breaking. Valid values: 0-1. These values represent 0% to 100%.
